title: 105_hr4093
content: The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" is cited as the short title. It establishes a standard relating to hospital lengths of stay for group health plans under the Public Health Service Act. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" requires group health plans to provide inpatient coverage for a medically appropriate period determined by a physician. It prohibits denying eligibility based on coverage requirements, penalizing providers for following the act, offering incentives to reduce inpatient stays, and requiring preauthorization for length of stay determinations. The "Hospital Stay Protection Act" mandates group health plans to cover inpatient stays as determined by a physician, prohibits eligibility denial based on coverage requirements, penalizes violators, and requires a preauthorization process for length of stay decisions. Additionally, there are provisions for an appeals process, penalties for non-compliance, and notice requirements for group health plans under this act. Section 713 sets standards for hospital lengths of stay in individual health insurance. The provisions of section 2706 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market as they do in the group health plan market. Health insurance issuers must comply with notice requirements similar to group health plans. Amendments made by subsections (a) and (b) apply to plan years starting on or after January 1, 1999. Special rule for collective bargaining agreements: For group health plans under collective bargaining agreements ratified before a certain date, the amendments made by subsections shall not apply to plan years starting before the later of the termination of the last collective bargaining agreement or January 1, 1999. Plan amendments made solely to conform to new requirements shall not be considered a termination of the collective bargaining agreement. The amendments made by subsection (b) apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market from January 1, 1999. Section 104(1) of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 is amended to coordinate regulations with other acts.
